column4: and your cd checks out (with the check that is on the boot menu of the cd)
why would we still think the cd is bad ?
ah
I have a problem with the partitioner  =  doesn't work , neither does gparted - possible routes to look at?

no idea why partititoning fails
can be many reasons
top 3?
a file left at the end of the partition? SCSI not supported? ?
scsi is of course supported since 1991 :-)
- what can I do to troubleshoot the partitioner? I am looking for logs, the errors are very generic
what was your problem agian ? Please describe
did it happen during install ? of the livecd or the alternate cd ?
the ubuntu 7.04 partitioner fails to partition, I then tried gparted. the error I pasted way back on here. cannot write the data it says.
you might try the alternate install cd, text based but I believe a stronger partitioner.
was your ntfs partition taking up the entire disk /
- entire disk, yes
so it wanted to resize the partition ? did you ask it to resize the ntfs partitiopn ?
- yes, the installer has a straightforward slider, I set it to 90% (I believe... erm, that means keep 90% of the disk? oh dear... I think I see a flaw in my plans)
eh ?
there you go !
but doesn't that mean, 50% of the remaining?
i don know, now maybe try it with other values and see if it works...
why worrying ?
